system: Windows 98/ME: Windows 98 and Windows ME (Millennium Edition) are two operating systems released by Microsoft in the late 1990s. Windows 98 was launched in 1998 and was a significant improvement over its predecessor, Windows 95. It introduced new features such as USB support, improved multimedia capabilities, and a more user-friendly interface. Windows ME, released in 2000, was the last operating system in the Windows 9x line and was designed to be a consumer-oriented operating system. It included features such as System Restore, which allowed users to easily restore their system to a previous state in case of problems, and improved multimedia support. Despite their popularity at the time, both operating systems are now considered outdated and are no longer supported by Microsoft.
